Experience Senior Patent Attorney and Portfolio Manager Intel Corporation March 2004  – Present (11 years 6 months) Austin, Texas Area Attorney responsible for managing Intel's worldwide semiconductor process patent portfolio. This portfolio specializes in front-end semiconductor technologies which include device fabrication, substrate fabrication, metallization, lithography, and integration. Duties further include preparing and prosecuting patent applications in technology areas such as semiconductor processing, semiconductor packaging, wireless networks, consumer graphics, and mobile platforms, as well as providing general intellectual property counseling. Member of Board of Directors Texas Accountants and Lawyers for the Arts July 2013  – Present (2 years 2 months) Austin, TX Texas Accountants and Lawyers for the Arts (TALA) is a not-for-profit organization that helps meet the legal and accounting needs of artists and arts nonprofits across the State of Texas. TALA volunteers throughout the state handle more than 350 matters per year. This amounts to more than $600,000 annually in donated services to the arts and cultural community. 
 
TALA’s pro bono legal and accounting services are offered to artists from all creative disciplines, including visual artists, musicians, actors, dancers, film makers and writers. Over 600 attorneys and accountants volunteer their time each year, assisting in legal and accounting matters that might otherwise remain unresolved and unrepresented. TALA’s services include legal and accounting assistance, nonprofit incorporation, dispute resolution services, and educational programs and publications for artists and arts nonprofits to help apply legal and accounting concepts for their benefit. Summary Jason Kang is a senior patent counsel at Intel’s Litigation, Licensing and Patents Group. He manages Intel’s graphics IP portfolio and has extensive experience in patent drafting, prosecution, appeals and post-grant proceedings. He performs strategic offensive/defensive patent reviews and advises the business units on IP matters. He also manages Intel’s pro bono program in Asia and has assisted several non-profit organizations with their legal needs. 
 
Jason holds a B.Eng. (Hons) (Electrical Engineering) from NUS, a M.Sc. (Integrated Circuit Design) from NTU, and a LL.B. (Hons) from NUS law school. He is an Advocate & Solicitor of the Supreme Court of Singapore and serves on the IP Practice Committee of the Law Society of Singapore which provides regular feedback in public consultations on legislative and practice changes in IP law. He is also a member of Association of Singapore Patent Attorneys and Singapore Law Academy. Summary Jason Kang is a senior patent counsel at Intel’s Litigation, Licensing and Patents Group.
